name: pcshare

procedures: T1005::[PcShare] can collect files and information from a compromised host.
T1012::[PcShare] can search the registry files of a compromised host.
T1016::[PcShare] can obtain the proxy settings of a compromised machine using `InternetQueryOptionA` and its IP address by running `nslookup myip.opendns.comresolver1.opendns.com\r\n`.
T1027::[PcShare] has been encrypted with XOR using different 32-long Base16 strings and compressed with LZW algorithm.
T1036.001::[PcShare] has used an invalid certificate in attempt to appear legitimate.
T1036.005::[PcShare] has been named `wuauclt.exe` to appear as the legitimate Windows Update AutoUpdate Client.
T1041::[PcShare] can upload files and information from a compromised host to its C2 servers.
T1055::The [PcShare] payload has been injected into the `logagent.exe` and `rdpclip.exe` processes.
T1056.001::[PcShare] has the ability to capture keystrokes.
T1057::[PcShare] can obtain a list of running processes on a compromised host.
T1059.003::[PcShare] can execute `cmd` commands on a compromised host.
T1070.004::[PcShare] has deleted its files and components from a compromised host.
T1071.001::[PcShare] has used HTTP for C2 communication.
T1106::[PcShare] has used a variety of Windows API functions.
T1112::[PcShare] can delete its persistence mechanisms from the registry.
T1113::[PcShare] can take screen shots of a compromised machine.
T1125::[PcShare] can capture camera video as part of its collection process.
T1140::[PcShare] has decrypted its strings by applying a XOR operation and a decompression using a custom implemented LZM algorithm.
T1218.011::[PcShare] has used `rundll32.exe` for execution.
T1546.015::[PcShare] has created the `HKCU\\Software\\Classes\\CLSID\\{42aedc87-2188-41fd-b9a3-0c966feabec1}\\InprocServer32` Registry key for persistence.

description: [PcShare](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1050) is an open source remote access tool that has been modified and used by Chinese threat actors, most notably during the FunnyDream campaign since late 2018.(Citation: Bitdefender FunnyDream Campaign November 2020)(Citation: GitHub PcShare 2014)
